info.name: Project Management System - GraphQL API
info.description:
Comprehensive Postman collection for the Project Management System GraphQL API.

## Overview
This API provides complete CRUD operations for:
- **Organizations**: Multi-tenant organization management
- **Projects**: Project lifecycle management
- **Tasks**: Task tracking with status workflow
- **Comments**: Task discussion and collaboration

## Quick Start
1. Set the `baseUrl` variable to your server (default: `http://localhost:8000`)
2. Start with creating an Organization
3. Create Projects within the Organization
4. Add Tasks to Projects
5. Add Comments to Tasks

## GraphQL Endpoint
All requests go to `{{baseUrl}}/graphql`

variable.description: Base URL for the API server

item.name: üè¢ Organizations
item.description: Organization management endpoints. Organizations are the top-level entity for multi-tenancy.

request.description:
Create a new organization. Organizations are the root entity for multi-tenancy.

**Required Fields:**
- `name`: Organization name
- `contactEmail`: Primary contact email

**Optional Fields:**
- `slug`: URL-friendly identifier (auto-generated if not provided)
Create a tech startup organization for testing multi-tenancy.
Retrieve all organizations in the system with their project counts.
Get a single organization by ID with its associated projects.
Retrieve an organization using its URL-friendly slug.
Get comprehensive statistics for an organization including project and task counts.
Update organization details. Only provided fields will be updated.
Get complete organization data including all projects, tasks, and their details.

item.name: üìÅ Projects
item.description: Project management endpoints. Projects belong to an organization and contain tasks.

graphql.variables:
{
    "organizationId": {{organizationId}},
    "name": "Website Redesign",
    "description": "Complete redesign of the company website with modern UI/UX",
    "status": "ACTIVE",
    "dueDate": "2025-12-31"
}

request.description:
Create a new project for website redesign.

**Status Options:**
- `ACTIVE`: Currently in progress
- `PLANNING`: In planning phase
- `ON_HOLD`: Temporarily paused
- `COMPLETED`: Finished
- `CANCELLED`: Abandoned
Create a mobile app development project in planning phase.
Create an API integration project.
Retrieve all projects across all organizations with task statistics.

graphql.query:
query ProjectsByOrganization($organizationId: Int!) {
  projectsByOrganization(organizationId: $organizationId) {
    id
    name
    description
    status
    dueDate
    taskCount
    completedTasks
    inProgressTasks
    todoTasks
    completionRate
  }
}

request.description: Get all projects belonging to a specific organization.
Filter projects by ACTIVE status within an organization.

graphql.query:
query GetProject($id: Int!) {
  project(id: $id) {
    id
    name
    description
    status
    dueDate
    taskCount
    completedTasks
    inProgressTasks
    todoTasks
    completionRate
    createdAt
    organization {
      id
      name
      contactEmail
    }
    tasks {
      id
      title
      status
      assigneeEmail
      dueDate
    }
  }
}

request.description: Get a single project with all its details and tasks.
Get detailed task statistics for a project.
Update project details. Only provided fields will be changed.
Mark a project as completed with organization verification.

item.name: Project Detail with Tasks and Comments

request.description: Get complete project data including all tasks and their comments.
Delete a project. Requires organization ID for multi-tenancy verification.

item.name: ‚úÖ Tasks
item.description: Task management endpoints. Tasks belong to projects and have a status workflow.

request.description:
Create a new task for homepage design.

**Status Options:**
- `TODO`: Not started
- `IN_PROGRESS`: Currently being worked on
- `DONE`: Completed
Create a backend development task.
Create a frontend development task.
Create a testing task.
Create a documentation task without a due date.
Retrieve all tasks across all projects and organizations.
Get all tasks belonging to a specific project.
Get all tasks across all projects in an organization.
Filter tasks by IN_PROGRESS status.
Get all tasks assigned to a specific user.
Get all TODO tasks in an organization.
Get a single task with all details and comments.
Move task from TODO to IN_PROGRESS status.
Reassign a task to a different team member.
Mark a task as completed.
Update task status with transition validation (e.g., TODO ‚Üí IN_PROGRESS ‚Üí DONE).

graphql.variables:
{
    "id": {{taskId}},
    "title": "Design Homepage Mockup v2",
    "description": "Updated: Include mobile responsive designs",
    "status": "IN_PROGRESS",
    "assigneeEmail": "lead-designer@acme.com",
    "dueDate": "2025-08-25T17:00:00"
}

request.description: Update multiple task fields at once.
Delete a task with organization verification.

item.name: üí¨ Task Comments
item.description: Comment management for task collaboration and discussion.

request.description: Add a new comment to a task for team collaboration.
Add a progress update comment.
Add manager feedback comment.
Add a technical note with resource links.
Get all comments for a specific task.
Update an existing comment's content.
Delete a comment by ID.

item.name: üìä Dashboard & Reports
item.description: Complex queries for dashboards, reports, and analytics.

request.description: Get a comprehensive dashboard view with organization stats, active projects, and pending tasks.
Get all tasks grouped by assignee for workload analysis.
Get project health metrics including completion rates and task distribution.
Get all tasks with due dates for overdue analysis (filter client-side for overdue items).

graphql.query:
query CompleteOrganizationReport($id: Int!) {
  organization(id: $id) {
    id
    name
    slug
    contactEmail
    projectCount
    activeProjectCount
    createdAt
    projects {
      id
      name
      description
      status
      dueDate
      taskCount
      completedTasks
      inProgressTasks
      todoTasks
      completionRate
      createdAt
      tasks {
        id
        title
        description
        status
        assigneeEmail
        dueDate
        commentCount
        createdAt
        comments {
          id
          content
          authorEmail
          createdAt
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

request.description: Get complete organization data export including all projects, tasks, and comments.

item.name: üîí Multi-Tenancy Testing
item.description: Test multi-tenancy isolation and security boundaries.

request.description: Create first organization for multi-tenancy testing.
Create second organization for multi-tenancy testing.
Create a project in Organization A.
Create a project in Organization B.

**EXPECTED TO FAIL**

Attempt to update a project from Organization A using Organization B's context.

This should return `success: false` with an organization mismatch error.

**EXPECTED TO FAIL**

Attempt to create a task in Organization A's project using Organization B's context.

**EXPECTED TO FAIL**

Attempt to delete Organization A's project using Organization B's context.

item.name: üß™ Error Handling Tests
item.description: Test validation and error handling scenarios.

request.description: Test validation error when required field (contactEmail) is missing.
Test response when querying a non-existent organization.
Test error handling when creating project with non-existent organization.
Test error handling when creating task with non-existent project.
Test validation when using an invalid status value.
Test error when updating a non-existent task.
Test error when adding comment to non-existent task.

item.name: üöÄ Quick Setup Workflow
item.description: Run these requests in order to quickly set up test data.

request.description: Verify all demo data was created correctly.
